title: b'Tech Support Analyst'
job description:
b"The Senior Tech Support Analyst is responsible for providing business critical technical support for infrastructure integrations, desktop/end-user support, and daily operations for clinical environments. Clinical IT support services include Windows Server management, network infrastructure troubleshooting, desktop deployment and troubleshooting, and IT related medical services (Digital PACS System, EKG Devices, etc.).

Primary Responsibilities
Lead IT Network Infrastructure/Endpoints integration and standardization projects
Project management related IT operations and vendor engagement
Take ownership of customer issues and see problems through to resolution and provide enterprise level technical support in a clinical setting to our customers onsite or via phone, web, and email and other support channels as required in a timely manner
Provides dispatch support to managed clinics as escalated by Service Desk staff according to ITS department support policies
After-Hours On Call Rotation
Ensures that all requests from users are logged and escalation procedures are followed:
Thoroughly investigates customer issues and provides detailed documents of all facts around the issue for troubleshooting purposes, including the exact steps that produce the error, scope of error (one user or multiple users), time of day, software and driver versions, software and driver configurations, other processes running on system
Escalates fully documented issues to IT Management for further investigation or escalation to Engineering
Ability to perform as a technical lead for clinic integrations after acquisition
Expertise in configuring, installing, upgrading and trouble shooting in a PC LAN environment, or between multiple local area networks in a WAN environment
Experience in dealing with infrastructure and LAN/WAN technologies and supporting hardware; the ability to plan and direct the growth and expansion of managed networks
Research, diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve customer issues related to clinical application use, design and configuration
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts effectively both orally and in writing
Strong organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills and the ability to execute with a sense of urgency and with minimal supervision
Expert knowledge of VMware, Windows Server 2008/2012, Windows 7/10; to include installation and troubleshooting
Take issues elevated from Clinical IT Support and Service Desk staff as needed and directed by management
Performs employee Moves, Transfers and New Hire deployments, in accordance with ITS departmental rules and policies:
Accurately completes Deployment Checklist. Creates and deploys New User letter as prescribed in IT Department procedures
Informs Requesting Manager of task status and completion
Participates in after-hours Support phone rotation according to After Hours Support policy.

You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
Access to reliable transportation that will enable you to travel to client and/or patient sites within a designated area
Proficient in Network Fundamentals, Core understanding of Cisco Network equipment (Switches, Routers, Firewalls)
Proficient in Windows Server Administration (Windows 2008, 2012, 2016), DNS, DHCP, SSH, SSL, FTP, Group Policy, Replication, Windows DFS (Distributed File System)
Proficient in VMWare 4,5 and 6, Proficient in B2B VPN and VPN Clients

Preferred Qualifications
Server Hardware (iLO, RAID, Storage), SAN Technologies (iSCSI, NFS), Thin Client Administration, Endpoint Imaging, Disk Encryption (Bitlocker), WAN Technologies (MPLS or SD-WAN), Excellent troubleshooting and critical thinking skills, and Medical Devices (PACS, EKG, etc.)

What's the first thing that happens when one of the most successful physician groups in Orange County comes together with a global leader in health care? Opportunity. With Monarch HealthCare joining OptumCare and the UnitedHealth Group family of companies, people like you will find increasing levels of challenge, impact and professional success. With a vibrant network of hospitals and urgent care centers, we're changing health care for the better by improving access to affordable, high quality care, and working together to improve the patient experience. That takes passion, commitment, intense focus and the ability to contribute effectively in a highly collaborative team environment. Are you with us? Learn more about this exciting opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Job Keywords: Irvine, CA, California, Tech Support Analyst"

title: b'UX Design Internship at MediaMonks LA'
job description:
b'Description

MediaMonks has internship positions for future user experience experts who have the foresight to intern at MediaMonks.

Please keep in mind, due to COVID-19, we will not be immediately hiring for this position, but we look forward to reviewing your application for the near future. Thank you for understanding.*

About The Internship
In this paid internship position, you will join our all-star team of Monks at our monastery on Abbot Kinney to craft award-winning work on behalf of America\xe2\x80\x99s leading agencies and their brands.
As a UX Intern at MediaMonks, you\xe2\x80\x99ll learn what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to work with the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading agencies and brands to craft delightful experiences for A-list clients.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll join a UX team of all-stars to help devise the user experience for a diverse array of projects.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll get to see how client briefs develop into proposals, projects, deliveries, feedback, more feedback, \xe2\x80\x98final\xe2\x80\x99 feedback, and ultimately a final product.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll be creating flows, wireframes and prototypes like there\xe2\x80\x99s no tomorrow, laying the functional foundation for our visual designers.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll gather and generate new insights, and help to develop the very tools and methods we use for UX research and design.

Become a UX Monk
At MediaMonks, you\xe2\x80\x99ll join a young and fun, successful and super-fast-moving production company that people would kill to work for. In addition to great food, MediaMonks offers priceless parties and the best winter sports ever if you tag along during Easter.

Being an intern at MediaMonks is simply awesome. You\xe2\x80\x99ll get to do actual work for top-notch brands and businesses. But what is perhaps the most tangible testament to the unadulterated epicness of our internships are the many ex-interns that are still part of the pack. In fact, some of the first interns to join MediaMonks are now occupying the key positions within our company. With this prospect in mind, our ideal candidate is a graduate student who\xe2\x80\x99s looking to kick-start their UX career with a head start.

Please be attentive to the requirements for this role and accompany your resum\xc3\xa9 with a short motivation detailing why you\xe2\x80\x99re the right Monk for this internship. Be sure to add an updated portfolio with your best UX design thinking, interaction designs and flows.

Requirements
We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a UX student on a roll who will be enrolled throughout the internship.
You\xe2\x80\x99re passionate about devising excellent user experiences and eager to master the art of user research and interaction design.
You can grasp a product\xe2\x80\x99s structure and flow in no time, and capture it in crystal-clear diagrams.
Your great sense of empathy allows you to make user-centric decisions, based on the research and insights you help collect.
You can quickly visualize interface and interaction ideas in Sketch.
You install apps and sign up for services just because you\xe2\x80\x99re curious about the UX and onboarding process.
Your high level English allows you to understand and communicate complex problems and ingenious solutions.
If you have experience capturing and presenting your UX thinking and designs in presentations, that\xe2\x80\x99s a big plus.
A huge benefit if you already have hands-on experience with prototyping tools such as InVision, Marvel and Framer, or experience doing UX and competitor analysis, although not required.'

title: b'Junior Web Developer'
job description:
b"Description

Robert Half Technology is looking for a Junior Web Developer in Temecula, CA. Our client, an online retailer for commercial plumbing and air conditioning supplies, is in need of a web developer to help maintain their already existing website. You will be in charge of maintaining, expanding, and scaling our client's website. Responsibilities Include: Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices Create website layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices Create and maintain software documentation For consideration for this position please contact Mark Ecal @ 949-623-2673 Please send resumes to mark.ecal@rht.com I can also be reached via LinkedIn, connect with me at https://www.linkedin.com/in/markecal/

Requirements

Requirements: Proven working experience in web programming Programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS Familiarity with programming languages: Javascript, Java, .NET or etc. Adequate knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools Experience with eCommerce platforms - BigCommerce, Shopify or others Experience with Google AdWords Basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization process Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem solving skills Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field

Robert Half Technology matches IT professionals with some of the best companies on a temporary, project or full-time basis. From roles in software and applications to IT infrastructure and operations, we provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. Our personalized approach, innovative matching technology and global network with local market expertise help you find the technology jobs that match your skills and priorities \xe2\x80\x94 fast. By working with us, you have access to challenging opportunities, competitive compensation and benefits, and training to enhance your skill sets.

From philanthropy to environmental stewardship to employee programs, Robert Half is proud to have an active role in the communities in which we live and work. Our company has appeared on FORTUNE\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cMost Admired Companies\xe2\x80\x9d list every year since 1998.

Download our mobile app to take your job search on the go!

Contact your local Robert Half Technology office at 888.490.4429 or visit www.roberthalf.com/jobs/technology to apply for this job now or find out more about other job opportunities.

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

\xc2\xa9 2020 Robert Half Technology. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans."

title: b'Web QA Specialist'
job description:
b'As a Website Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be responsible for the quality and accuracy of new websites being launched for multiple clients. This will include pre- and post-launch QA of elements such as functionality, design, and content accuracy. Each client requires website design and content that benefits both the user and the company\xe2\x80\x94our goal is to build user-friendly, intuitive, SEO-friendly, and attractive websites that generate traffic, leads, and sales for clients. You will be evaluated on your ability to minimize mistakes and ensure the clients get error-free websites. We are looking for an individual to fill this position on a temporary basis (February 2020 - July 2020).

Role Responsibilities
Ensure each website meets our established standards of quality in terms of performance, functionality, usability, and design
Check overall accuracy (correct phone number, client name, content, etc.)
Test user-experience elements and design (navigation, calls-to-action, galleries, contact forms, etc.)
Analyze websites to find and report glitches and errors
Communicate with our design and development teams to provide edits with necessary information to improve websites
Ensure all edits are made correctly by our website development/design team
Collaborate with other teams (Project Management, Design, and Account Management) to help ensure website projects are completed in terms of the Statement of Work
Ensure client requests (in terms of new websites) are executed correctly
Ensure websites are launched with no errors, testing elements such as tracking codes, mobile design, and a list of other critical outputs
Participate in review of standards, procedures, tools, and processes with other teams
4-year college degree or equivalent work experience in a comparable industry
Experience editing or reviewing copy or websites for accuracy
Experience providing clear feedback and revisions to be completed by other team members
Extreme attention to detail with respect to accuracy, grammatical correctness, etc. and no tolerance for errors
Flexibility to shift priorities quickly and to understand the most urgent testing needs
Strong work ethic and a "do whatever it takes to get the best job done" attitude
Exemplary organization and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge of/familiarity with search engine optimization (SEO) best practices and techniques is a plus
Benefits of Working for Blue Corona
We work hard, but we maintain a fun and family-like environment filled with social events, birthday celebrations, and free lunch EVERY Friday.

About Blue Corona

Founded in 2008, Blue Corona is a data-driven online marketing company that helps businesses accurately measure and track their advertising efforts to generate more leads and sales from the web. For each client, Blue Corona implements inbound internet marketing strategies such as pay per click (PPC) advertising, search engine optimization (SEO), online lead generation, ad tracking, conversion rate optimization, and website redesigns. Blue Corona was ranked on the 2012 Inc. 500 list and has placed on the Inc. 500|5000 every year since (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019). The company has offices in both Gaithersburg, MD and Charlotte, NC.

As a Website Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be responsible for the quality and accuracy of new websites being launched for multiple clients. This will include pre- and post-launch QA of elements such as functionality, design, and content accuracy. Each client requires website design and content that benefits both the user and the company\xe2\x80\x94our goal is to build user-friendly, intuitive, SEO-friendly, and attractive websites that generate traffic, leads, and sales for clients. You will be evaluated on your ability to minimize mistakes and ensure the clients get error-free websites. We are looking for an individual to fill this position on a temporary basis (February 2020 - July 2020).

About Blue Corona

Founded in 2008, Blue Corona is a data-driven online marketing company that helps businesses accurately measure and track their advertising efforts to generate more leads and sales from the web. For each client, Blue Corona implements inbound internet marketing strategies such as pay per click (PPC) advertising, search engine optimization (SEO), online lead generation, ad tracking, conversion rate optimization, and website redesigns. Blue Corona was ranked on the 2012 Inc. 500 list and has placed on the Inc. 500|5000 every year since (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019). The company has offices in both Gaithersburg, MD and Charlotte, NC.'

title: b'Creative Production Coordinator'
job description:
b'Employees at Quad thrive at the intersection of thinking, making and marketing. As we continue to take the bold steps necessary to transform our offering, our goal is to provide our clients with the most powerful integrated marketing platform. We\xe2\x80\x99re all partners in our company, committed to do the right thing, trusting the process, innovating for the future, growing the business, believing in each other, and having a little fun along the way.

Quad is seeking a Creative Advertising Coordinator, for onsite customer facility in San Bernardino, CA. We are looking for dynamic and resourceful Advertising Coordinator who takes initiative and thrives in a fast-paced, challenging working environment. In this position, you will support Account Management and Client Services and help strategize and deliver organization\xe2\x80\x99s goals and plans with discipline and attention to details for a large grocery retail company.

You will be responsible for coordinating the daily advertising operations (both advertising and print production) of the account and developing strategies to optimize processes.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To
Coordinate and direct internal production team to execute all client development projects
Day-to-day customer contact and management of all details related to ongoing projects
Resolve and troubleshoots customer issues that arise and escalate when necessary
Effectively communicate with sales and project coordinators
Assist in development of forecast details required by client
The ability to read, write and comprehend complex projects and be a pro-active problem \xe2\x80\x9cpreventer\xe2\x80\x9d as well as a dynamic problem \xe2\x80\x9csolver\xe2\x80\x9d
Follow workflow processes to increase team productivity
Set schedules to meet client deadlines
Collaborate with client team members to acquire all project information required to perform work
Collaborate with other internal teams to develop customized strategies and solutions that will meet the client\xe2\x80\x99s business needs and expand our relationship
Establish a strong understanding of our client\xe2\x80\x99s products and their positioning in the marketplace as well as their business and industry as a whole

Qualifications
Minimum of two years\xe2\x80\x99 experience producing for catalogs, direct mail, signage, retail inserts, etc.
Knowledge of creating and working with templates and style sheets; including page formatting of copy, placing photos and artwork; producing multiple versions
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Experience in the prepress/graphics arts industry
Must be detail and deadline oriented with a dedicated work ethic
Must be able to multitask and to be flexible
Solid understanding of the entire creative and production process
Ability to maintain effective ongoing discussions and relationships with clients
Ability to collaborate effectively with diverse creative team members
Flexibility with work hours as needed to complete required tasks
Proficient computer skills including ability to utilize Microsoft Office applications, project management databases and email applications
Knowledge of steps required for the print process and an understanding of production methods to ensure designs can be produced for print delivery

Additional Company Information

We offer excellent benefits to eligible employees, including 401(k), holidays, vacations and more.

Quad/Graphics is an equal employment opportunity employer. The Company\xe2\x80\x99s policy is not to unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local laws. The Company also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.

Drug Free Workplace'

title: b'Programmer Analyst'
location: b'Los Angeles County, California, United States'
job description:
b"Programmer Analyst

Job Summary

Canoga Perkins is a leader in cutting edge 5G Fronthaul and Backhaul Ethernet transport products. We are looking for a dynamic Programmer Analyst professional to join our team. This position requires a person who can demonstrate expertise in OpenEdge Advanced Business Language (PROGRESS), can operate under minimal supervision, is a self-motivated fast learner, and is highly competent in developing innovative solutions for Business Processes

What you'll do

Analyze requirements and design, locate and maintain a variety of application software systems.
Consult with all levels of users to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input and output requirements.

What we're looking for

Strong verbal, written and people communication skills and the willingness to work cooperatively in a team environment
3-5 years of programming experience in OpenEdge Advanced Business Language (PROGRESS)
3-5 years QAD MFG/Pro experience
Ability to write and maintain technical specifications.
Comfortable analyzing and estimating feasibility, costs, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs.
Ability to research and evaluate software and hardware to assist in programming or to use as program platforms.
 Ability to design and code screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs, and interfaces with other systems.
Ability to estimate work and meet schedules
Ability to analyze existing technology utilized within the company and develop steps and processes to improve and expand upon them
Work closely with engineering professionals within the company to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of  initiatives

Must Have

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Computer Engineering, or related field. Graduate degree a plus.
3-5 years of experience.

Canoga Perkins offers an excellent incentive package including a bonus paid twice a year, participation in a generous Profit Sharing Trust as well as paid vacations and medical, dental and vision insurance. Contact Elsa Aguilera (HR) at 818-678-1812 or e-mail eaguilera@canoga.com

Canoga Perkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V"

title: b'Why Waterton?'
job description:
b'Why Waterton?

Founded over a box of Pop-Tarts\xc2\xae in 1995 by David Schwartz and Peter Vilim, Waterton has grown from very humble beginnings with one phone and two desks to the successful, nationally recognized real estate investment and management firm it is today. As Waterton has evolved and grown, one thing has remained constant, the drive to achieve results by exceeding expectations.

Waterton's values of Service Excellence, Empowerment, Integrity, Passion, Achievement and Teamwork are our guiding principles and they shape who Waterton is as an organization. When you join Waterton, you will learn new skills, acquire knowledge and use these values to help you grow in your career and fulfill your professional goals.

Waterton is committed to the service of our associates, residents, guests and investors and firmly believes that our superior ability to serve our customers differentiates us. We empower our associates to think and act like an owner and use our core values as guiding principles to serve our customers in a way that exceeds their expectations, going above and beyond to create the ultimate service experience or what we call Resitality!

Service Technician II

Waterton Residential is currently seeking an energetic, enthusiastic Service Technician II! As a maintenance professional, you will resolve maintenance issues, complete preventative maintenance, and maintain attractive, clean grounds and common areas. You will prepare vacated apartments for new residents by performing electrical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and general repairs. Above all, you will have a passion for exceeding resident expectations and providing exceptional customer service.

The ideal candidate will possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

Passion for providing exceptional customer service
2+ years of previous maintenance and service experience
EPA-CFC certification required
Certificate for Apartment Maintenance Technician (CAMT) preferred
Must have licenses or equivalent years of experience in plumbing, electrical, and/or carpentry
Certified Pool Operator certification and/or valid driver's license may be required
High School diploma or equivalent required
Ability to participate in the on-call schedule; evenings, weekends and/or holidays may be required


Waterton will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Initiative.

title: b'SpringSummer Intern'
job description:
b'Hiring Now
Spring/Summer Internship (applicant MUST be based in Southern California Counties)

We are moving up the Summer Solar Internship Program to help individuals affected by COVID-19. Edits to the program will allow select candidates the ability to work from home.

    Are you looking to transition from your studies to a direct experience in Renewable Energy? An internship that could lead to a full-time role in Project Development, Electrical Engineering or Construction Project Management?

    Lamplighter Energy is looking for a Spring/Summer Intern for our Renewable Energy Supply team. The Renewable Energy Supply team helps corporations and institutions (Commercial & Industrial buyers) purchase renewable power directly from onsite projects to meet their energy and sustainability goals. The team works to identify the best risk-adjusted projects and structures, running project design & scope analysis.

    As a part of our team the 12-week internship will include access to our Developer Training Program that includes direct training and mentoring with practical skills you\xe2\x80\x99ll learn to transition to a full-time role.

This internship will have a focus on utility-scale renewables, onsite solar, community solar, and renewable energy policy throughout the Southern California region. As an Intern, you will assist the team with a multitude of tasks, including:

\xe2\x80\xba Assisting in building a renewable energy project database by researching solar project sites in the target portfolio and keeping up to date profiles of projects and vendors.

\xe2\x80\xba Conducting in-depth research in both emerging and existing state-level renewable energy opportunities

\xe2\x80\xba Running preliminary evaluations of renewable project economics evaluating the qualitative merits and risks of renewable energy opportunities

\xe2\x80\xba Assisting in review of electrical tariffs and distributed generation policies on a client-by-client basis

\xe2\x80\xba Attending internal team meetings and sitting in on phone calls with clients, trade associations and developers

Qualifications

\xe2\x80\xa2  Self-Starter <<During Quarantine You\xe2\x80\x99ll be Required to Work From Home>>
\xe2\x80\xa2  Strong analytical skills and excellent attention to detail
\xe2\x80\xa2  Strong communicator both written and verbal in English.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Proficiency in any of the following applications and software is considered a plus:
           Google Docs, ArcGIS, Salesforce, CRM
\xe2\x80\xa2  Academic and/or work experience in the fields of renewable energy, sustainability, engineering, clean tech, environment, economics, business, and/or finance

   Lamplighter Energy, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity & affirmative action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

To be considered for a position with LLE, please send a cover letter and resume to: sejal@lamplighterenergy.com

Deadline to apply: COB Wednesday, April 8, 2020'

title: b'Back of the House LEAD'
job description:
b'In 1762, John Montagu, the fourth Earl of Sandwich, had his hands full, literally. As First Sea Lord, he commanded the mighty British Navy, was a noted explorer, and also a dedicated gambler with a love of day long card games.

This led to little time for food, so he came up with the ingenious idea (some say at the card table) of putting meat between two slices of bread. From then on it did not matter if you were fighting a great sea battle or laying down a Royal Flush, you could eat great food without too much fuss.

Thus in 1762, the sandwich was named after its inventor, John Montagu, the 4th Earl of Sandwich. Now 250 years later, the current 11th Earl and the Sandwich family remain passionate about the world's most popular quick food that carries their name and have developed the sandwich everyone has been waiting for\xe2\x80\xa6The World's Greatest Hot Sandwich\xc2\xae We are looking for individuals to continue the tradition!

Earl of Sandwich is passionate about 100% guest satisfaction!

We are currently seeking energetic, passionate, and dedicated individuals to join our team at our new location in Long Beach.

Earl Of Sandwich Is Looking For
Sandwich Makers
Prep Cooks
Experience working in a high volume, quick casual or fast casual restaurant preferred

Proficient in verbal and written communication

Cash-handling And Customer Service Experience Strongly Preferred

If you meet these qualifications and have the desire to deliver the world's best service while serving "The World's Greatest Hot Sandwich"...this could be the career of your dreams!

We look forward to you joining our team!

title: b'Media Support Analyst'
job description:
b'Our client, a leader in the streaming and Entertainment landscape, is searching for a knowledgeable Media Support Analyst. They need someone with knowledge of intellectual property, relevant technologies and terminologies. Must have strong interpersonal skills, be a team player, work hands-on, and be able to multi-task with accuracy and meet deadlines. Communicate and coordinate strategy, programs and services with a diverse group of business stakeholders. The Media Support Analyst develops and maintains business-relevant metrics and key performance indicators to measure program maturity and effectiveness

Most Days You:

Performs operational services for Intellection Property department, including monitoring various video platforms by leveraging search systems to identify potential pirated content.
Provide dedicated coverage for large streaming sites and manage daily backend rights management queues.
Reduce the amount of uptime of unauthorized videos and video streams by managing queues within streaming systems.
Identify gaps in reference library and fill the gaps by locating and ingesting missing content.

You Bring:

3+ years previous knowledge or experience working with large streaming video related operations.
BA/BS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or relevant industry experience.
Reactive searches upon request and monitoring of received emails calling out pirate content on streaming sites.
Assist IP Security Analyst with forensic data ingestion, data auditing, and reporting.

Nice-To-Haves:

Ongoing support for rest of Operations team and Intellectual Property Department.
Savvy with PC/Mac environments, Office 365 Suite, including advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Experience managing and/or supporting an enterprise technology tool, including customer support, troubleshooting, and testing.

If interested, please apply!


The Solomon Page Distinction

Solomon Page offers a comprehensive benefit program for hourly employees. We pride ourselves on offering medical, dental, 401(k), direct deposit and commuter benefits to our employees, including freelancers \xe2\x80\x93 which sets us apart in the industries we serve.

About Solomon Page

Founded in 1990, with 14 offices and counting, Solomon Page is a specialty niche provider of staffing and executive search solutions across a wide array of functions and industries. The success of Solomon Page reflects an organic growth strategy supported by a highly entrepreneurial culture. Acting as a strategic partner to our clients and candidates, we focus on providing customized solutions and building long-term relationships based on trust, respect, and the consistent delivery of excellent results. For more information and additional opportunities, visit: solomonpage.com and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Opportunity Awaits.'

job description:

Candidates must be capable of working dynamically within multidisciplinary teams, have a strong interest in branding and corporate identity, and be familiar with creating brand identity work. title: b'Project Engineer'
job description:
b"Overview

Performs tasks related to the collection of cost data required to monitor project budget and estimates. Requires the selection and application of resource monitoring and control principles, techniques and technical knowledge of construction project.

What You Will Be Doing
Meets with engineering and field crews to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.
Reviews all shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data through the duration of the project to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.
Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.
Evaluates daily production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.
Updates project schedule weekly for owner and management reporting. Attends weekly owner meetings; presents on project production status as needed.
Perform additional assignments per management\xe2\x80\x99s direction.
Prepares and manages a three-week work plan. Notifies engineering and project management of any significant schedule changes and develops solutions to mitigate delays and cost.
Initiates and manages all Requests for Information (RFIs), as needed by project.
Remits accurate project quantities using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages invoicing with Company accounting team regarding materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.
Supports engineering team with quality assurance as needed. Reviews certificates and permits needed to perform work. Participates in all worksite tours with leadership or external parties.
Reviews required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Participates in all weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.
Assists the estimating team with project schedule, budget and cost parameters by providing technical input as needed.
Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.
Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.
Reconciles job close-out checklist with owner representative and field crews at the end of the project.
Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.

What We Are Looking For
Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.
3+ years construction engineering experience required.
Experience in resource monitoring techniques (i.e. cost accounting, basic estimating) and construction technology, process systems and/or structures preferred.
Able to identify budget and project costs and recommend options to mitigate project delays.
Possess verbal, written and presentation skills.
Knowledge of design build and other alternative build techniques.
Knowledge of financial reporting methods, quantity tracking methods and cost coding.
Knowledge of construction scheduling and production time management preferred.
Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.

Why work for us

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:
Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer."

title: b'Pricing Analyst I'
job description:
b'Job Details

Job ID: 11488

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That\xe2\x80\x99s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers\xe2\x80\x94literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission\xe2\x80\x94your opportunity\xe2\x80\x94is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you\xe2\x80\x99re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you\xe2\x80\x99re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

In this position, you will be a member of the Cost Estimation and Pricing Section and will report to the Group Supervisor of the Pricing Office. You will be responsible for providing Laboratory wide support for the generation for cost/price detail including proposals, Task Plans, ROM\xe2\x80\x99s, what-if exercises, etc. through utilization of JPL approved pricing tools and proper application of JPL\xe2\x80\x99s published rates and factors. Provide audit support, analysis for cost information in support of customer and JPL management reviews, compliance reviews to ensure JPL is consistent with internal as well as Government regulations, review to ensure adequacy of supporting cost detail (i.e. Basis of Estimates? And required approval of pricing detail in support of any submittal that can potentially commit the Laboratory. Provide support and leadership to proposing teams to ensure completeness of estimating for material and subcontracted efforts in proposals and task plans. Support cost analysis on subcontract proposals as necessary.

Qualifications
Typically requires a BA/BS degree with 0-5 years of directly related experience or MA/MS degree in Business/Finance or related discipline with 0-3 years of directly related business experience or equivalent.
Some knowledge in one or more of the following areas: proposal preparation, proposal pricing and cost estimating, business forecasting, financial resource management and contract administration.
Ability to handle assignments that are multidimensional and cross disciplinary in nature.
Ability to interface effectively with all levels of program/project management, technical organizations and with the NASA customer.
Must be resourceful and self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Must have excellent computer skills.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a project environment preparing technical proposals and utilizing cost models.
Experience with project reporting, contract administration, integrated cost/schedule planning, cost analysis and cost estimating.
Knowledge of earned value systems and the direct application to project performance with respect to cost and scheduling.
Experience with estimating, costing and scheduling of large space mission systems/subsystems elements and small instrument builds.
Knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.

Work Authorization

Ability to Obtain Work Authorization

Connect with Us

Not ready to apply? Connect with us for general consideration.'

title: b'Global Investment Banking Summer Analyst 2020 - Los Angeles 1'
job description:
b'What is the opportunity?

RBC Capital Markets is a premier investment bank that provides a focused set of products and services to corporations, institutional investors and governments around the world. With more than 7,100 professionals, we operate out of 70 offices in 15 countries across North America, the U.K., Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region.

We work with clients in over 100 countries around the world to deliver the expertise and execution required to raise capital, access markets, mitigate risk and acquire or dispose of assets. We are consistently ranked among the largest global investment banks according to Bloomberg and Dealogic.

RBC Capital Markets is part of a leading provider of financial services, Royal Bank of Canada (RBC). Operating since 1869, RBC is one of the top 15 largest banks in the world and the fifth largest in North America, as measured by market capitalization. With a strong capital base and consistent financial performance, RBC is among a small group of highly rated global banks.

U.S. Summer Analyst Program

Each year, we invite high-performing, rising college seniors to join our Global Investment Banking (GIB) platform for a 10-week U.S. Summer Analyst Program. The program offers Summer Analysts an opportunity to work alongside our investment bankers on a variety of live transactions as well as client-facing business development initiatives.

What will you do?

Industries

GIB provides a complete suite of strategic advisory services, as well as equity and debt capital raising capabilities for leading corporations, institutions and governments. RBC Capital Markets\xe2\x80\x99 investment banking platform focuses on nine core industries and seven product groups. Within our San Francisco office, we recruit for the following industry and product groups:
Healthcare
Technology

Product Groups
Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)
Private Placements

As a GIB Summer Analyst you will spend your time:
Developing and preserving complex financial models
Creating pitch books and other client materials
Generating and maintaining financial models and analysis
Conducting research to analyze market trends
Supporting live deals and major transactions

What do you need to succeed?

In Selecting Analysts, We Look For The Following
Undergraduate students in their penultimate year of study at an accredited four-year college or university
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Familiarity with computer applications such as MS Outlook, Word, and Excel
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment
Value and possess strong competency in the following behaviors: Collaboration, Relationship Building, Communication, Integrity and Operating with Diverse and Inclusive Mindset
Well-rounded set of interests and extra-curricular activities beyond academics

What\xe2\x80\x99s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, think progressively, continue our growth, and deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our individual/collective potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

From This Experience You Would Gain
A strong foundation in fundamental investment banking skills such as financial modeling and analysis, transaction execution and negotiation, and in-depth industry/product knowledge
A better understanding of RBC\xe2\x80\x99s products and services
The support of a mentor (typically a full-time Analyst)
An opportunity to network and discuss career opportunities through a number of social events
Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.'

title: b'SharePoint Developer'
job description:
b'Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.

Responsibilities

In this SharePoint Developer role, you will be accountable for the activities of the project team and support the day-to-day management of the client relationship. You are expected to effectively develop and manage work plans, staffing, deadlines and budgets for multiple complex projects simultaneously. We encourage career development and hiring for the long term. As you are ready drive strategic solutions across multiple complex workstreams and become more involved in business development, you will have the opportunity to progress to the Associate Director level.

Rewards And Benefits

title: b'Web Developer'

 Talento has partnered with a $5B US retailer with 1,000 stores and a large eCommerce presence. They are looking for a Sr. Web Developer with extensive experience in eCommerce building API\xe2\x80\x99s  to improve functionality, reliability and usability to a business critical application.

evelop new application code as well as create integrations to pass data to and from internal/external systems like POS, Ecommerce, ERP, CRM and 3rd party vendors via ESB using multiple Restful APIs, web services, FTP files, etc.

title: b'Backend Web Developer'
job description:
b"Job Description

title: b'Web Developer/ Designer'
job description:
b"Information & Responsibilities
California Institute of the Arts is seeking a Web Developer/Designer to join our Communications team. We are seeking someone with a forward-looking sensibility who can work with the design, development and content staff to produce material that can be adapted across various digital media platforms. An interest in and experience with email design, information architecture and the ability to enable and enhance user experience are essential. The position will require someone with a knowledge of front-end web development and design and a strong appreciation for the technical aspects of digital work, as well as the ability to multitask and handle several deadlines at once.

Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Develop mail marketing/template designs.
Assisting in the development of email protocols and streamlined processes throughout the Institute\xe2\x80\x99s schools and departments.
Maintaining current websites by working with content producers to ensure accurate information and well-designed layout for schools and departments.
Building informational and team sites on the CalArts intranet.
Resizing and optimizing graphics and video.
Work with other team members to deliver integrated digital and web solutions across multiple platforms.
Assist, as needed, with the design of new websites.
Research and stay current on effective UI/UX trends.
Maintain an awareness of contemporary digital graphic design.
Other duties as assigned on an as-needed basis.
Requirements
Experience designing/building websites from concept to launch.
Knowledge in HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript with a keen eye for design details.
Attention to detail needed to execute visual design well on the web.
Strong working knowledge of responsive web and email design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting.
Familiar with and comfortable building for Content Management Systems, specifically DNN, Drupal, and WordPress.
Familiar with Adobe Creative Suite (many design files will come to you as either a PSD or InDesign file).
Believer in best practices and always aiming for clean, efficient code.
Experience developing/working with information architecture.
Creativity in problem solving.
Ability to work in a team and to communicate clearly.
Enthusiastic creative thinker, with a desire to learn new skills.
Collaborate with other campus technical staff and developers as needed.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google and Adobe applications.
Critical thinking skills required.
Interest or experience with motion graphics is a plus.
Perform other job-related duties and special projects as assigned.
Qualifications
At least two (2) years related, professional experience;
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree desired
How to Apply
This position is available immediately. If you are interested, please follow this link to apply https://apply.interfolio.com/74609

Equity & Diversity

California Institute of the Arts (CalArts) seeks to employ faculty who can engage our diverse communities of learners at the highest levels of artistic endeavor and critical thinking. Across the range of practitioners from artists to scholars and librarians, we welcome candidates who possess a demonstrated worldview and cultural competency to support teaching and mentoring undergraduate and graduate students of varied backgrounds, capabilities, perspectives, social identities andgender expressions.CalArts is an equal opportunity employer.

Further Information

CalArts has a multidisciplinary approach to its studies of the arts through six schools: Art, Critical Studies, Dance, Film/Video, Music and Theater. CalArts encourages students to explore and recognize the complexity of the many aspects of the arts. It is supported by a distinguished faculty of practicing artists and provides its Bachelor and Master of Fine Arts students with the hands-on training and exposure necessary for an artist's growth. CalArts was founded in 1961 and opened in 1969 as the first institution of higher learning in the United States specifically for students interested in the pursuit of degrees in all areas of visual and performing arts."

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"About Higher Ground Education

At Higher Ground Education, we're driven by a deep desire to bring about widespread change in education today. We believe that the traditional method of education used in most schools is antiquated, outdated, and broken. To meet the needs of today's students and to bring about true progress in the world around us, we need an education model that fosters independence and develops competent, capable, action-oriented thinkers and change agents.

We believe that the key to international education reform lies in modernizing and mainstreaming the hugely impactful Montessori pedagogy. It is only then that we will succeed in enabling children across the world to realize their human potential as knowledge-guided, value-oriented, efficacious beings, so that they experience, undiluted and unimpeded, the joyous process of growing into successful adults.

Since our founding 3 years ago, we have opened 47 beautiful schools across the U.S. serving students from birth through high school. We have also launched an innovative, blended-learning training organization to fuel our growth.

The Web Developer Position

The Web Developer will work closely with the marketing and engineering teams to engage thousands of families and grow their awareness and engagement with Higher Ground Education and our multiple school brands.

This role will have a particular focus on optimizing our web marketing funnels and will live primarily on the digital marketing team. The digital marketing team runs outreach, engagement, cross-selling, and educational campaigns across email, social, and community channels. We are data-driven in everything we do.

Key Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To
Front-end design and development for websites and landing pages, including WordPress, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Implementation of rich conversion tracking and A/B testing suites to optimize our marketing growth funnel
Quick ideation and creation of microsites and splash pages, in tandem with our marketing calendar
The further optimization of websites and other web marketing channels via A/B testing and conversion funnel improvements
Reporting with other departments based on pre-defined metrics

We'd love to talk to you if you possess:
3+ years of experience coding websites in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
3+ years of experience in creating website designs in Adobe, Sketch, and/or any other preferred design tools
Strong familiarity with WordPress and/or other CMS systems or website templating engines
Experience implementing growth tools such as A/B testing experiments, email marketing campaigns, Salesforce for CRM, and other tracking tools
A high degree of initiative and autonomy to lead your own initiatives
A performance- and results-oriented mindset
A bachelor's degree preferred in relevant field
A portfolio of work available on request

We'd really love to talk to you if you also possess:
Coding experience in ASP.NET MVC and its front-end Razor syntax
Comfort in working with APIs and in bridging the gaps between the front-end and back-end databases and third-party applications
Comfort stepping into pre-existing codebases and branding decisions, working to make them your own over time


What We Offer
A competitive salary
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Paid time off and paid holidays
100% tuition discount for two children at any school within our network (we serve children as young as 6 weeks through 12th grade).
Open to remote work
Fun training & onboarding at HQ
A network of supportive peers and mentors who regularly share best practices
Career growth and promotion opportunities
The opportunity to contribute to a high-quality educational program that serves the individual needs of each child

Want to get to know us better? Check out:
The Higher Ground Story:\xe2\x80\xafhttp://bit.ly/HGEStory
The Higher Ground Mission:\xe2\x80\xafhttp://bit.ly/HGEMission
Facebook:\xe2\x80\xafFacebook.com/highergroundeducation"

job description:

:

We support every major platform, including desktops, mobile devices, smart TVs, streaming devices, and gaming consoles, providing an opportunity to work across platforms and teams to push Plex forward.

title: b'Web Application Developer'
job description:
b'Web Application Developer

About Us

Torrance Job Description:

Phyn is changing the way people think about water. In just nine years nearly two in three people may face a shortage of clean water. Yet in the U.S alone, people unknowingly waste a trillion gallons of water per year, largely because it\xe2\x80\x99s an invisible problem that is hidden behind the walls, underground, or simply ignored. But what if it could become more visible? We believe that creating the tools to bring issues to light before they start is the key to saving water, saving money and, just maybe, saving the planet.

Phyn is the result of nearly a decade of research, development, and testing. We are currently searching for a Web Developer to accelerate our successful post launch plans. You will be a critical member of a small, customer focused, engineering team for our React JS and React Native Web, iPhone and Android applications. This isn\xe2\x80\x99t an average position where you might be restricted to one small piece of the company\xe2\x80\x99s technology, but one where you\xe2\x80\x99ll have influence over our whole web and mobile program, from design to production. If you want to work on products that will have an impact on solving a major global issue with tremendous growth opportunity, this is the opportunity to consider.

The successful candidate has sufficient experience and expertise to imaginatively address tasks/assignments of a medium to complex level. Structures and manages the execution of project/program tasks with little guidance and supervision and recommends and executes new approaches. Assignments will require technical analysis and inventive design recommendations for cost effective resolutions of problems. Coordinates across functional groups to ensure all tasks and input are received. Leads technical support staff in testing and analysis. Contributes ideas and/or concepts that support the generation of intellectual property. The successful candidate takes initiative and demonstrates self-motivation and enthusiasm to solve problems.

What We Want You To Do
Develop browser based responsive dynamic web applications.
Experienced with React JS, Redux and Node.js frameworks.
Expert level understanding of JavaScript and CSS.
Experience working with UX Design Tools such as Invision.
Work with UX Team and produce excellent UI confirming to UX requirements.
Familiarity with mobile application development using React Native for iOS and Android.
Work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements and use cases, then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution.
Integrate with our backend services to make sure we are delivering a great web and mobile user experience that\xe2\x80\x99s super-fast for end users.
Help improve code quality through writing unit tests, automation and performing code reviews.
Participate in brainstorming sessions and have the chance to contribute innovative and original ideas to our technology, algorithms and product.
Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results within a schedule.


Who You Are

You want to work on challenging problems with smart people. You\xe2\x80\x99re someone who could get positions at most software companies, but you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for the perfect role that has great leadership, a roster of top talent, game-changing product vision, and a work hard/play hard company culture.

You also meet most (if not all) of the following requirements:
Requires a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in computer science or any other technical discipline with equivalent experience.
Employees entering this job typically have 5 or more years of directly related experience in web application development with a demonstrated record of leadership designing and shipping products/features.
Personal commitment to continuously learn and improve.
5 to 7 years of recent hands-on software design and coding experience.
A track record of projects completed on time \xe2\x80\x93 you are a flawless executor and know how to build great software.
Evidence of being self-motivated and driven \xe2\x80\x93 you find satisfaction in a job well done and want to solve hard problems.
Solid OOP and software design knowledge \xe2\x80\x93 you should know how to create software that\xe2\x80\x99s extensible, reusable and meets desired architectural objectives.
Experience with dynamic web application development and a willingness to learn new technologies if needed (ideally you have shipped at least one substantial web application and know how to integrate with backend RESTful APIs).
Experience with mobile application development preferred.


Experience With WordPress Preferred

What you\xe2\x80\x99re getting into

We\xe2\x80\x99ve got big collaborative spaces for your big ideas, so bring an open mind and leave your suit in the closet. We all are committed to creating unique and rewarding consumer experiences. Everyone is interested in succeeding \xe2\x80\x93 for the team, for themselves and for the business. Cross-functionally and across the company, everyone has common goals and aspires to be their best.

You will learn something new or at least look at things differently every day. There are so many smart and creative people around that you\xe2\x80\x99ll be motivated to pursue the ideal.

Team spirit is infectious. Belkin is an extremely open workplace, where communication is essential. Not every idea will be accepted, but you\xe2\x80\x99ll be asked for your point of view. Innovation thrives on multiple and varied levels. At Belkin we challenge conventional wisdom and refuse to accept that something cannot be done.

We are committed to diversity. Belkin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace.

All candidates applying for a job in the EMEA region, please review the Applicant Privacy notice HERE
Location: Torrance, California

Posted 14 Days Ago Full time 10008978

At Belkin International, people come first. Without question, the single greatest contributing factor to our nearly 30 years of success is our talented and ambitious staff. We\xe2\x80\x99ve found that by creating an inspirational, supportive and enriching environment, we thrive.

Around here, it\xe2\x80\x99s not about fancy titles, strong political positioning skills, or a healthy list of names to drop. It\xe2\x80\x99s about results. We know what needs to be achieved, and we work together to get the job done. Each of us uses our individual knowledge, creativity and resources to come up with fresh ideas and new concepts we can truly own. With that independence comes a high degree of responsibility and accountability, but we always rise to the occasion.

title: b'Backend Web Developer'
job description:
b'Have you ever build any of the most popular open-source browsers like Brave/Chromium/Firefox?

Would you be excited to the idea of setting up build pipelines for an open source browser?

System1 is hiring a Web Developer (back-end development) to join our team. This is a diverse role that will involve \xe2\x80\x9chacking\xe2\x80\x9d on the Mozilla platform, mostly on the backend. You will work with experts who know the Mozilla platform inside-out, while being a key contributor to novel open-source products which already have a passionate and growing user base.

Key goals for this role: Keep a \xe2\x80\x9cclassic\xe2\x80\x9d version of the browser up-to-date with security patches; update components where possible and create better compatibility with legacy add-ons for the newer version of the platform that supports them. Build system work is required for this role sometimes, but that\xe2\x80\x99s one of the fun parts!

The Role You Will Have
Write code and tests, build prototypes, tackle problems, profile and analyze bottlenecks
Learn about a wide variety of problems and solutions across a large, mature codebase (ex: how can we improve on the UX, make transitioning from other browsers easier, support legacy add-ons better?)
Must be familiar with JavaScript, C/C++, and Python
Work with driven, committed team members to help bring the most customizable web browser to a larger audience.

What You Will Bring
BS/MS in CS, CE or 3+ years relevant work experience
You are comfortable reading and writing in JavaScript and C/C++
You care deeply about making the browser fast and customizable (it takes trial and error to make things work on this code base, patience is ideal)
Proficiency setting up build pipelines for binaries with Multi OS support
Strong debugging skills (Valgrind, GDB)
Experience working with version control systems (especially git).

Bonus Points if You Have
Exposure to the internals of the Mozilla platform (SpiderMoney engine), or curiosity and drive to learn from experts on the team.
Interest in privacy and privacy-aware technologies.

What We Have To Offer
Free Uber/Lyft to and from work every day!
Collegial and collaborative team with highly intelligent and motivated coworkers
Cross-team lunches and demos to foster learning
Unlimited Paid Sick Time, Competitive PTO and Benefits package
Daily catered meals and fully stocked kitchen
Bi-weekly happy hour at various bars, restaurants, and venues across Los Angeles
Bi-weekly onsite happy hour
Catered dinner on Tuesdays and Thursdays
Weekly fitness class with private trainer: high intensity training, yoga, beach volleyball, beach soccer, ultimate frisbee
Company parties and outings: Skyzone indoor skydiving, Medieval Times, Karaoke, etc.

Related Searches: Backend Developer, Back-end Developer, Backend Web Developer, C/C++, Javascript,'

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b'Web Developer
 Talento has partnered with a $5B US retailer with 1,000 stores and a large eCommerce presence. They are looking for a Sr. Web Developer with extensive experience in eCommerce building API\xe2\x80\x99s  to improve functionality, reliability and usability to a business critical application.

This is a remote contract that will last 2-3 months. The organization uses APTOS CRM & POS for the eCommerce website and stores. The web developer will serve as an SME on APTOS to build a seamless and fast connection between Synchrony (credit card issuer), the POS and CRM.

You will come solve this problem: When a buyer applies for a credit card online, they get approved/declined, you need to build the connection that takes the data from Synchrony through a secure data packet, take that file, decode it, adjust format data appropriately and insert it into the CRM record in APTOS.
 Responsibilities
Develop, design, test and debug applications starting at their foundation up to their production environments
evelop new application code as well as create integrations to pass data to and from internal/external systems like POS, Ecommerce, ERP, CRM and 3rd party vendors via ESB using multiple Restful APIs, web services, FTP files, etc.
Coordinate development efforts with internal teams and external teams
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability while ensuring application security
Build reusable code and libraries for future use
Ability to communicate technical issues effectively to non-technical parties
Team player mindset with ability to work independently and take initiative

Requirements
7+ years of web development experience
Experience implementing APIs
2+ years of recent experience of CRM development with APTOS
Strong experience with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and common JavaScript libraries such as jQuery required
Experience with supporting and maintaining business critical applications
Ability to prepare technical documentation
Must have strong application testing discipline
Knowledge of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) best practices is a plus

Talento Human Capital Management provides talent and organizational solutions enabling businesses to evolve beyond tactical human resources management. Our footprint spans across the US with teams in Miami Chicago NYC Los Angeles and throughout South America and Asia in Lima & India.

Our organization continues to thrive through our ongoing commitment to building an inclusive and diverse workforce from different backgrounds perspectives and skills. Talento Human Capital Management (HCM) is an equal opportunity employer and people are at the center of what we do!

People + Passion + Perseverance = Progress'

title: b'Backend Web Developer'
job description:

full time

In addition to the value we provide for our employees and policyholders, we are also renowned for our philanthropic work, having donated over $109M to nonprofits over the past 33 years. title: b'Web Developer/ Designer'
job description:
b"Information & Responsibilities
California Institute of the Arts is seeking a Web Developer/Designer to join our Communications team. We are seeking someone with a forward-looking sensibility who can work with the design, development and content staff to produce material that can be adapted across various digital media platforms. An interest in and experience with email design, information architecture and the ability to enable and enhance user experience are essential. The position will require someone with a knowledge of front-end web development and design and a strong appreciation for the technical aspects of digital work, as well as the ability to multitask and handle several deadlines at once.

Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Develop mail marketing/template designs.
Assisting in the development of email protocols and streamlined processes throughout the Institute\xe2\x80\x99s schools and departments.
Maintaining current websites by working with content producers to ensure accurate information and well-designed layout for schools and departments.
Building informational and team sites on the CalArts intranet.
Resizing and optimizing graphics and video.
Work with other team members to deliver integrated digital and web solutions across multiple platforms.
Assist, as needed, with the design of new websites.
Research and stay current on effective UI/UX trends.
Maintain an awareness of contemporary digital graphic design.
Other duties as assigned on an as-needed basis.
Requirements
Experience designing/building websites from concept to launch.
Knowledge in HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript with a keen eye for design details.
Attention to detail needed to execute visual design well on the web.
Strong working knowledge of responsive web and email design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting.
Familiar with and comfortable building for Content Management Systems, specifically DNN, Drupal, and WordPress.
Familiar with Adobe Creative Suite (many design files will come to you as either a PSD or InDesign file).
Believer in best practices and always aiming for clean, efficient code.
Experience developing/working with information architecture.
Creativity in problem solving.
Ability to work in a team and to communicate clearly.
Enthusiastic creative thinker, with a desire to learn new skills.
Collaborate with other campus technical staff and developers as needed.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google and Adobe applications.
Critical thinking skills required.
Interest or experience with motion graphics is a plus.
Perform other job-related duties and special projects as assigned.
Qualifications
At least two (2) years related, professional experience;
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree desired
How to Apply
This position is available immediately. If you are interested, please follow this link to apply https://apply.interfolio.com/74609

Equity & Diversity

California Institute of the Arts (CalArts) seeks to employ faculty who can engage our diverse communities of learners at the highest levels of artistic endeavor and critical thinking. Across the range of practitioners from artists to scholars and librarians, we welcome candidates who possess a demonstrated worldview and cultural competency to support teaching and mentoring undergraduate and graduate students of varied backgrounds, capabilities, perspectives, social identities andgender expressions.CalArts is an equal opportunity employer.

Further Information

CalArts has a multidisciplinary approach to its studies of the arts through six schools: Art, Critical Studies, Dance, Film/Video, Music and Theater. CalArts encourages students to explore and recognize the complexity of the many aspects of the arts. It is supported by a distinguished faculty of practicing artists and provides its Bachelor and Master of Fine Arts students with the hands-on training and exposure necessary for an artist's growth. CalArts was founded in 1961 and opened in 1969 as the first institution of higher learning in the United States specifically for students interested in the pursuit of degrees in all areas of visual and performing arts."

title: b'Web Developer'
job description:
b"About Higher Ground Education

At Higher Ground Education, we're driven by a deep desire to bring about widespread change in education today. We believe that the traditional method of education used in most schools is antiquated, outdated, and broken. To meet the needs of today's students and to bring about true progress in the world around us, we need an education model that fosters independence and develops competent, capable, action-oriented thinkers and change agents.

We believe that the key to international education reform lies in modernizing and mainstreaming the hugely impactful Montessori pedagogy. It is only then that we will succeed in enabling children across the world to realize their human potential as knowledge-guided, value-oriented, efficacious beings, so that they experience, undiluted and unimpeded, the joyous process of growing into successful adults.

Since our founding 3 years ago, we have opened 47 beautiful schools across the U.S. serving students from birth through high school. We have also launched an innovative, blended-learning training organization to fuel our growth.

The Web Developer Position

The Web Developer will work closely with the marketing and engineering teams to engage thousands of families and grow their awareness and engagement with Higher Ground Education and our multiple school brands.

This role will have a particular focus on optimizing our web marketing funnels and will live primarily on the digital marketing team. The digital marketing team runs outreach, engagement, cross-selling, and educational campaigns across email, social, and community channels. We are data-driven in everything we do.

Key Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To
Front-end design and development for websites and landing pages, including WordPress, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Implementation of rich conversion tracking and A/B testing suites to optimize our marketing growth funnel
Quick ideation and creation of microsites and splash pages, in tandem with our marketing calendar
The further optimization of websites and other web marketing channels via A/B testing and conversion funnel improvements
Reporting with other departments based on pre-defined metrics

We'd love to talk to you if you possess:
3+ years of experience coding websites in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
3+ years of experience in creating website designs in Adobe, Sketch, and/or any other preferred design tools
Strong familiarity with WordPress and/or other CMS systems or website templating engines
Experience implementing growth tools such as A/B testing experiments, email marketing campaigns, Salesforce for CRM, and other tracking tools
A high degree of initiative and autonomy to lead your own initiatives
A performance- and results-oriented mindset
A bachelor's degree preferred in relevant field
A portfolio of work available on request

We'd really love to talk to you if you also possess:
Coding experience in ASP.NET MVC and its front-end Razor syntax
Comfort in working with APIs and in bridging the gaps between the front-end and back-end databases and third-party applications
Comfort stepping into pre-existing codebases and branding decisions, working to make them your own over time


What We Offer
A competitive salary
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Paid time off and paid holidays
100% tuition discount for two children at any school within our network (we serve children as young as 6 weeks through 12th grade).
Open to remote work
Fun training & onboarding at HQ
A network of supportive peers and mentors who regularly share best practices
Career growth and promotion opportunities
The opportunity to contribute to a high-quality educational program that serves the individual needs of each child

Want to get to know us better? Check out:
The Higher Ground Story:\xe2\x80\xafhttp://bit.ly/HGEStory
The Higher Ground Mission:\xe2\x80\xafhttp://bit.ly/HGEMission
Facebook:\xe2\x80\xafFacebook.com/highergroundeducation"

job description: b"Description We are looking for experienced Sr. Web Developer who will be responsible for the development, maintenance and enhancement of our new E-Commerce platform as well as other online websites. *\nDeveloper will be responsible for data exchange and system integrations utilizing third party feeds, Web Services/API's etc. * As a senior member of the team, you will be expected to drive throughout their life cycle: requirements, architecture/design, implementation, testing, and launch. * Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards with Up-to-date latest web trends, techniques and technologies * Proven ability to translate complex business needs into technical solutions * Leads and participates in medium to large scale projects * Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions ,Troubleshoots business and production issues , Ability to work well under tight schedules * Minimum Requirements SKILLS & ABILITIES (Technical Skills/ knowledge required) Technical Skills/ knowledge required * 5+ Years of full-time professional Web Development experience and working experience with Enterprise Magento Version 1 or 2 and extensions * Experience with PHP, AJAX, JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS3 * Must be Proficient with Linux and Linux Commands , Knowledge with NGINX and Fast-CGI * Experience with MySQL Database - Views, Stored Procedures, Triggers, Indexes * Experience with Building Web Services/API's of REST, CURL, SOAP * Secure development using GitHub * Object oriented programming concepts and design * A plus for experience with Node.js, Angular and AWS cloud * A plus for experience with Mobile Applications built with Swift, Java or Phone Gap * E-commerce retail industry experience Education * BS degree in related field or relevant work experience"

title: b'Web App Developer (React)'
job description:

:

We support every major platform, including desktops, mobile devices, smart TVs, streaming devices, and gaming consoles, providing an opportunity to work across platforms and teams to push Plex forward.
